flow.descriptionCdata:
b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.02e9ef71-1a86-42c2-9767-0bc4a843fef3.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.052770fe-da27-4e87-91da-e453d313a559.description=
Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the context variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the context variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.18cfb87d-6f9d-4160-b0d1-d5ca91c73a87.description=
 Detects the operating system that is running on the specified host.

Inputs\:
    host - The host to connect to.
    username - The username to use when connecting.
    password - The password to use when connecting.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. The name and the version of the operating system.
    osName - The completely returned string of the OS name.
    version - The operating systems version.
    hostName - The host name the remote computer reports for itself.
    enterprise - 'true' if the operating system is an enterprise edition
    server - 'true' if the operating system is a server edition
    professional - 'true' if the operating system is a professional edition.
    standard - 'true' if the operating system is a standard edition.

Responses\:
    windows - Remote host is running a version of windows.
    linux - Remote host is running linux.
    solaris - Remote host is running solaris.
    other unix - Remote host appears to be unix based, but is an unknown variant.
    failure - System could not determine remote hosts operating system.

Notes\:
1. The enterprise, server, professional and standard results give more details about what version of windows is detected and are always set to 'false' if a unix system is being run.
2. The operation returns the output of a uname -a for unix based hosts, and the results of osName and version WMI queries for a windows host.

Responses\: greater than - value 1 > value 2. less than - value 1 < value 2 equal - value 1 \=\= value 2. failure - the two values could not be compared, or could not be parsed. b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.352da291-9a97-4464-becd-fc9c0dcd9459.prompt=Percentage of packet loss that is considered acceptable. b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.373a2353-f195-457c-b19a-979055e9f0df.transition.description=${target} was pinged from ${host} and had ${latency} latency and ${percent_loss}% packet loss. b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.42201032-3585-456e-8fc9-a7eaf137170c.transition.description=Invalid input latencyThreshold b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.44258b1a-3809-44a8-a7da-9a5b18a4b818.prompt=username for host b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.45882e6a-07a2-4d14-92ed-0bd9f3332680.transition.description=${target}'s latency from ${host} was\: ${latency}, which was above threshold. b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.45a81a43-7b3e-4678-88bf-c54570df4500.prompt=Threshold for maximum acceptable average latency b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.518a0889-417d-470f-8166-86dd02934442.transition.description=${target} lost ${percent_loss} packets from ${host}, which was above threshold. b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.5a484141-49a8-4258-b939-7791109efa13.transition.description=The OS system is a version of Linux. b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.5cf1abd3-2a24-4e76-ad74-c34eb8b22300.description=

If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true. failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false. b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.7f8ddd5f-a51a-4bbb-a0c6-4f8835dba69c.prompt=Enter a value for value2 b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.81f7b09f-f971-4e20-85d2-0c01f8c6a207.prompt=Enter a value for host b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.8774b4a7-9569-44c7-bf5a-24964348ac3e.prompt=Enter a value for username b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.8bf475ef-4d49-43ea-b3f2-f345c50cbd03.prompt=Enter a value for password b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.8d197d3b-3324-4416-9341-87d18d483122.description=

b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.9a4166b4-b1b8-4d0f-bfd1-2fa534a3a18e.description=
Runs a Ping command either locally or remotely depending on the specified protocol. Credentials and other inputs (remoteOS, hostname, username, password, keyFile etc) are required if the command must be run from a remote host. The Telnet protocol also requires inputs for usernamePrompt and passwordPrompt. 

Inputs\:
    hostname - Hostname or IP address of the host computer where the Ping command will be executed.
    username - A username to authenticate to the host computer. 
    password - The password for the user account.
    targetHost - Hostname or IP address of the target host computer.
    protocol  - The protocol used to run the command.
Valid values\: local, ssh, Telnet
    packetSize - The size of the ping packet.
    packetCount - The number of ping packets to send.
    remoteOS - The operating system of the host computer (WINDOWS, LINUX, SOLARIS only are supported), if Ping is running on a remote host.
    usernamePrompt - The username prompt seen while using Telnet protocol. This input is required when Telnet protocol is used. For example, login\:.
    passwordPrompt - The password prompt seen while using Telnet protocol. This input is required when Telnet protocol is used. For example, password\:.
    keyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
    timeout - The timeout in miliseconds for the Ping operation. Default is 90000.

Responses\:
    success - The command executed successfully.
    failure - The command could not be executed or had a problem during execution.

Returns\:
    packetsSent - The number of packets sent.
    packetsReceived - The number of packets received.
    percentagePacketsLost - The percentage of packets lost.
    transmissionTimeMin - Minimum time taken for transmitting the packet.
    transmissionTimeMax - Maximum time taken for transmitting the packet.
    transmissionTimeAvg - Average time taken for transmitting the packet.
    returnResult - Raw output of the command.
    returnCode - Return code of the executed command.
    error - The STDERR of the command.
b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.a141ff93-69fb-4d74-9e71-64036b9c84c9.prompt=HostName\: b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.a355ccc8-c3ef-41c3-988f-4544e31c273c.description=
Pings the target computer from a Windows host computer.

Input Parameters\:
host 		- The hostname or IP address of the host computer to ping from.
user 		- Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank). The user to authenticate as.
password 		- Password of the user.
target 		- The target computer to ping.
packets 		- The number of packets to send to the target computer.
packetSize 		- The size of packets to send to the target computer.
command 		- DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE.
characterSet 	- The character encoding of the target computer. The default is the RAS machine's default encoding.
outputPath 		- A network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible it should be changed to use another share that the local system account on the host computer has write-access to. By default, the path must be changed on Windows 2000 computers.

Responses\:
success 		- The target computer responded to all ping requests.
failure 		- The target computer did not respond to any ping request.
diagnosed		- The target computer responded only to some ping requests.
Connection Error	- The host computer could not be found or user credentials supplied to connect to it are incorrect.
Unknown Target	- The target computer could not be resolved to an IP address.

Result\:
The output of the ping operation.

Extra Results\:
returnResult		- The raw output of the Ping operation.
address 		- The actual IP address of the target computer.
% Packet Loss 	- The percentage of packets that ping replies were not received for.
average latency	- The average ping response time in milliseconds.
max latency 		- The maximum response time of all the ping reqeusts (in milliseconds).
min latency 		- The minimum number of milliseconds that was taken to receive a ping response.

Note\: The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must be compatible for the host and RAS systems, otherwise the command file created to execute the command becomes garbled causing an error while executing.

Adds a value into the global context (available to all parent and child flows)

b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.d3fc573a-5414-4615-9625-89da5f1126d6.prompt=Host to ping b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.de7e8690-ae72-48b0-824e-dae84ad66267.prompt=Enter a value for targetHost b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.description=
Checks to see whether or not a connection exists, and if it exists checks to see if it is adequately reliable.

Inputs\:
host - The host to ping from.
username - The username for host.
password - The password for host.
lossThreshold - What percentage of packet loss you consider to be acceptable for this connection.
latencyThreshold - How long (in milliseconds) you consider to be an acceptable latency for this connection.
target - The host to ping.
characterSet - The character encoding of the target computer. The default is the RAS machine's default encoding.

Outputs\:
result - Connectivity tests results message


Responses\:
success - The test passed.
diagnosed - A problem was found.
failure - Something went wrong.

Notes\:
1.The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must be compatible for the host and RAS systems, otherwise the command file created to execute the command becomes garbled causing an error while executing.
2. Recommended Thresholds\:
Connection Type		Loss Threshold (%)	Latency Threshold (ms)
DSL modem			2		200
Cable modem		2		200
dialup modem		2		500
ISDN Line			2		150
T1/T3/OCR			2		80
10 ethernet			2		10
Wireless			2		600
b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.e466b8d3-b309-4dc4-a878-ac8377996e40.prompt=password for username b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.eaff4d13-c191-4dbc-bd2b-d67716d1a5d4.description=Performs a mathmatical operation on two numbers Inputs\: operation - The operation to perform. value1 - the first value. value2 - the second value. Returns\: The result of the operation, for boolean values this is true or false. Responses\: success - The operation completed successfully. If a boolean operation, it evaluated to true. failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false. b1e8dfa0-b975-41c7-84ac-249565aa8dda.f2633aef-dfe3-4121-82e9-c80950581418.transition.description=Invalid input lossThreshold
flow.name: Connectivity Test

staticBinding.value: ${host} could not ping ${target} for an unknown reason.
${host} pinged ${target}, but had high network latency. Average latency of: ${latency}ms and ${percent_loss}% packet loss.
${host} could not ping ${target} for an unknown reason.
${host} pinged ${target} and had an average latency of: ${latency}ms and ${percent_loss}% packet loss.
${host} pinged ${target}, but had high packet loss. Average latency of: ${latency}ms and ${percent_loss}% packet loss.
Invalid lossThreshold ${lossThreshold} for ${host} while trying to ping ${target}
Invalid latencyThreshold ${latencyThreshold} for ${host} while trying to ping ${target}
